173.title: Pique denied final Barcelona appearance after getting sent off from bench at half-time
173.article_body: Barcelona defender Gerard Pique was denied the chance to make a final appearance for his club after getting sent off from bench at half time against Osasuna in a La Liga match. Pique was shown a red card after remonstrating with match officials. Pique was reportedly protesting against Robert Lewandowski being sent off earlier in the match.

174.title: US state of Maryland legalises marijuana, 4 other states vote
174.article_body: Voters in the US state of Maryland have approved legalisation of recreational marijuana, becoming 20th state to do so. Adults over 21 years of age will be allowed to possess up to 1.5 ounces of marijuana and will be permitted to grow two plants away from public view. Arkansas, Missouri, North Dakota and South Dakota are voting on the same.

175.title: India should be worried about facing Eng who are a better team: Vaughan
175.article_body: Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan said Team India should be "worried" about facing England in the upcoming T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final between the two teams, adding that England are a "better white-ball team". "95 per cent...[of the crowd will support India] and England generally love [such an] atmosphere," he stated. "India...do not bat aggressively enough early on," said Vaughan.

176.title: Five Star Business Finance's ₹1,960-crore IPO opens today
176.article_body: The IPO of Five Star Business Finance, which provides small business loans and mortgage loans to micro-entrepreneurs and self-employed individuals, opened on Wednesday and the subscription will close on Friday. The price band of the issue has been fixed at ₹450 to ₹474/equity share. It is an offer for sale of 4.1 crore shares aggregating to ₹1,960 crore.

177.title: Media needs to be vigilant, flag govt’s shortcomings: Manmohan Singh
177.article_body: The media needs to remain vigilant and flag shortcomings of the government with a view to improve the effectiveness of governance, ex-PM Manmohan Singh said on Tuesday. On the role of the media in a democracy, Singh said it has a very important contribution to make in the process of nation-building. He was speaking at the TIOL Heritage Award function.

178.title: Amitabh Bachchan says he used to fast on Karwa Chauth for Jaya Bachchan
178.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan revealed that he used to keep Karwa Chauth fast for his wife and actress Jaya Bachchan. In a conversation with a contestant on 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 14', Big B said, "Shuru shuru me hum bhi rakhte the, fir chhod diye (I also used to fast initially, but then I stopped)." Amitabh and Jaya got married in 1973.

179.title: Why should I ignore hurtful comments: Sanjana on her 'chappal jaisi shakal' reply to troll
179.article_body: Sanjana Ganesan, who told a troll he has a "chappal-like face", wrote, "He instantly [deleted] the comment, [reported] my comment and [turned] his profile private." "If you're a troll and can't take one single negative comment...why am I expected to ignore...hurtful comments?" she added. The troll had commented, "You aren't beautiful enough for Jasprit Bumrah" on her post.

180.title: Anupam says Kirron Kher's 'cancer is in remission', calls her 'fighter'
180.article_body: Anupam Kher said Kirron Kher's recovery from cancer was the "biggest relief" and mentioned that her cancer "is in remission". Kirron was diagnosed with multiple myeloma in 2021. "She's a fighter...Giving up is not an option. Because you're known, you become a role model for people," he added. He shared that Kirron was "lucky to have wonderful doctors" in Mumbai.

181.title: Take criticism of collegium in positive light: Justice Chandrachud
181.article_body: Justice DY Chandrachud said criticism of the collegium system must be looked at in a "positive light" and attempts made to improve it. "While we work within the fold of that system…yet at the same time, there are several improvements which we can bring about because no institution in any constitutional democracy can lay claim to be perfect," he added.

182.title: Justice DY Chandrachud takes oath as the 50th Chief Justice of India
182.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu on Wednesday administered the oath of office to the new Chief Justice of India, Justice DY Chandrachud, at the Rashtrapati Bhavan. Justice DY Chandrachud is the 50th Chief Justice of India, succeeding Justice Uday Umesh Lalit. Justice Chandrachud will serve as the CJI for two years till November 10, 2024.

183.title: doola raises $8 mn in funding round led by Nexus Venture Partners
183.article_body: Fintech company doola, earlier known as StartPack, has raised $8 million in a funding round led by Nexus Venture Partners. It saw the participation of the Y Combinator Continuity Fund, among others. Arjun Mahadevan and JP Pincheira founded the startup in 2020 with its headquarters in New York City. doola helps its customers incorporate and access the US payment systems.

184.title: 1-on-1 mentorship is key to securing top tech roles: Scaler
184.article_body: Scaler shared that its learners prepare for in-demand tech roles by interacting one-on-one with seasoned tech professionals who help them set goals, understand complex concepts, get feedback, and stay motivated. Having worked at top tech companies, mentors share valuable insights from the industry that gives learners the extra edge to create a solid impact in their tech career, it added.

185.title: World's richest man Musk's net worth falls below $200 bn as Tesla shares decline
185.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk’s net worth dropped below $200 billion after Tesla shares hit a 52-week low on Tuesday. According to Forbes, this is only the second time since October 1, 2021, that Musk has been worth less than $200 billion. Tesla has seen its value fall by 14% since Musk completed the $44 billion acquisition of Twitter.

186.title: Delhi's air quality remains 'very poor' with 329 AQI; Noida's AQI at 269
186.article_body: Delhi's overall air quality on Wednesday morning was recorded in the 'very poor' category with an air quality index (AQI) of 329, as per the System of Air Quality and Weather Forecasting And Research (SAFAR). Meanwhile, the air quality in Gautam Buddha Nagar was recorded in the 'poor' category with an AQI of 269 at around 9 am.

187.title: Maura Healey becomes 1st openly lesbian governor in US history
187.article_body: Maura Healey made history by becoming the first woman to be elected governor of Massachusetts and the first openly lesbian governor in US history. Healey, who was previously a civil rights lawyer, won the race against Republican Geoff Diehl. Jane Swift was first woman to fill Massachusetts Governor office in 2001, but she was appointed to the role, not elected.

188.title: Dropping Karthik for NZ tour during T20 WC 2022 wasn't right: Kaif
188.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Mohammad Kaif said "dropping" Dinesh Karthik for India's tour of New Zealand during T20 World Cup 2022 wasn't right. "It affects the player...He feels the pressure. This...[has been] clearly seen in Karthik's case...The road ahead seems very difficult for Karthik," added Kaif. "Only Rishabh Pant will play now, irrespective of whether he does well or not," he stated.

189.title: Earthquake of magnitude 4.3 hits Uttarakhand's Pithoragarh
189.article_body: A 4.3-magnitude earthquake occurred in Uttarakhand's Pithoragarh at around 6.27 am on Wednesday. The depth of the earthquake was 5 km below the ground, the National Center for Seismology stated. This comes after Nepal was struck with an earthquake of 6.3-magnitude at around 2 am on Wednesday. The tremors were also felt across parts of Delhi-NCR.

190.title: Feel like a proud parent: Farah on 15 years of Deepika in Bollywood
190.article_body: Choreographer-director Farah Khan said she feels "like a proud parent" about actress Deepika Padukone, who completed 15 years in Bollywood today. "Whenever I go abroad and see people recognising her, I feel so proud...she has evolved and matured so much over the years," Farah said. Deepika made her Bollywood debut with Farah's 'Om Shanti Om', which released in 2007.

191.title: Pet-care startup Supertails raises $10 million in Series A funding
191.article_body: Tech-enabled pet-care startup Supertails raised $10 million in Series A round led by ﻿Fireside Ventures﻿, alongside existing investors ﻿Saama Capital﻿ and ﻿DSG Consumer Partners﻿. Other angel investors such as CRED Founder Kunal Shah, Genesis Luxury Fashion Founder and President Sanjay Kapoor, Mamaearth Co-founder and CEO Varun Alagh, among others also participated in the round.

192.title: Twitter to introduce 'Official' label for some verified accounts on launch of $8 plan
192.article_body: Twitter will introduce an "Official" label for selected verified accounts when it launches the $8 blue tick subscription service, said Twitter executive Esther Crawford. She added that not all previously verified accounts will get the "Official" label and that the label isn't available for purchase. Accounts that will receive it include government accounts, media outlets and some public figures.

193.title: 'The Crew' is my most fun & glamourous project yet: Rhea Kapoor
193.article_body: Filmmaker Rhea Kapoor called 'The Crew' her "most fun and glamorous project", starring Kareena Kapoor Khan, Kriti Sanon and Tabu. The film will be co-produced by Ekta Kapoor, who tagged Rhea as a filmmaker who "knows what she wants". "Rhea has a new, fresh, loud and clear voice...(in her) I found a creator I loved to align with," Ekta said.

194.title: My agent told Sir Alex not even a dog would sign deal he offered: Pogba
194.article_body: Discussing the contract he was offered by Manchester United's ex-manager Sir Alex Ferguson at 18, midfielder Paul Pogba said, "[My former agent] Mino Raiola told him that not even a dog would've [signed] it." "We stormed off, leaving him stunned," added Pogba. "Sir Alex arrived a little late [for] the meeting...We were waiting for him," he stated.

195.title: In pics: Last total lunar eclipse of 2022 from around the world
195.article_body: The world witnessed the last lunar eclipse of this year on Tuesday. It was the last total eclipse for the next three years because the next time this phenomenon will occur in March 2025. This gallery contains images of the eclipse from Mexico, El Salvador, China, Australia, Venezuela, Japan, Guatemala, and the last two photos are from Ranchi and Delhi.

196.title: BBMP chief sets November 15 deadline for filling potholes in B'luru
196.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Commissioner Tushar Giri Nath has set November 15 as the deadline to fill potholes within the municipal limits. Before this, the deadline was November 10. "Around 800-1,000 potholes are filled every day," Nath told the media on Tuesday. "Around 6,000-6,500 potholes are yet to be filled," a BBMP official said.

197.title: 6 killed as house collapses after 6.6-magnitude earthquake hits Nepal
197.article_body: Six people were killed after a house collapsed following an earthquake in Nepal. Nepal's seismological centre set the earthquake at a magnitude of 6.6, however, the United States Geological Survey pegged the earthquake at a magnitude of 5.6. Media reports after the quake showed tremors were also felt in New Delhi and surrounding areas.

198.title: Layoffs at Meta to begin on Wednesday, CEO Mark Zuckerberg tells staff: Report
198.article_body: Meta will begin laying off employees on Wednesday morning, said CEO Mark Zuckerberg, reported The Wall Street Journal. Zuckerberg reportedly addressed hundreds of workers on Tuesday and said he was accountable for the firm's missteps and that his overoptimism about growth led to overstaffing. Expected to affect thousands, the layoffs could be the most significant in the company's 18-year history.

199.title: Fire brigade short of 1,200 men in Mumbai; recruitment to start in Dec
199.article_body: The Mumbai Fire Brigade (MFB) is facing a shortage of 1,200 personnel and 100 drivers and it will take the department at least 10 months to be fully operational, a senior BMC official said. The fire brigade is supposed to run on a total strength of 3,500 men, he added. The recruitment for the fire department will start in December.

200.title: Rashmika shares post on 'receiving lot of hate', calls herself 'punching bag'
200.article_body: Actress Rashmika Mandanna took to Instagram and wrote, "I have been on the receiving end of a lot of hate ever since I started my career. Quite literally a punching bag for a lot of trolls and negativity out there." "It's...demoralising when I'm being ridiculed and mocked by the internet especially for things that I have not said," she said.

201.title: Actor Leslie Phillips, who voiced Sorting Hat in Harry Potter films, passes away aged 98
201.article_body: British actor Leslie Phillips, known for his roles in the 'Carry On' comedies and voicing the Sorting Hat in Harry Potter movies, has passed away aged 98. Phillips' agent Jonathan Lloyd confirmed the star died peacefully in his sleep on Monday. The comic actor starred in more than 200 films, and TV and radio series over his eight-decade career.

202.title: US ticket-holder wins $2.04 billion in biggest lottery jackpot in world history
202.article_body: A ticket-holder in US' California won the $2.04-billion Powerball jackpot, believed to be the largest lottery jackpot in world history. The winning ticket was the only one to match all five white balls as well as the Powerball. The odds of matching all six numbers in the drawing were 1 in 292.2 million.

203.title: World Cup-bound referee shows 10 red cards in Argentina cup final
203.article_body: Referee Facundo Tello, who'll be officiating matches in the upcoming 2022 FIFA World Cup, handed out 10 red cards amid a brawl between Boca Juniors and Racing Club in Argentina's Champions Trophy final. Tello sent off seven Boca players and three from Racing, who won the match 2-1 in extra time. Two red cards were shown before full-time.

204.title: Norwegian princess quits royal duties to work with fiancé who is an American 'shaman'
204.article_body: Princess Märtha Louise of Norway has relinquished her royal duties to focus on her alternative medicine business with her fiancé Durek Verrett, who's a self-proclaimed American shaman. The palace said once they get married, Durek would become a member of the royal family but wouldn't have a title. Norwegian media had accused Märtha of using her title for commercial gain.

205.title: Elon Musk sells Tesla shares worth $3.95 billion after Twitter takeover
205.article_body: After taking over Twitter, Elon Musk has sold 19.5 million shares of Tesla worth $3.95 billion. With this sale, the total value of Tesla shares sold by Musk since he disclosed his stake in Twitter in April, reached nearly $20 billion. Earlier when he sold Tesla stock in April and August, he said there were no further sales planned.

206.title: Strong tremors felt in Delhi, North India as 6.3-magnitude earthquake hits Nepal
206.article_body: A 6.3-magnitude earthquake hit Nepal at around 2 am on Wednesday, as per the initial data by National Center for Seismology. The depth of the earthquake was around 10 km, as per preliminary data. Strong tremors were felt in Delhi-NCR and several other parts of North India. On Tuesday night, a 3.5-magnitude earthquake had also struck Nepal.

207.title: Focus on our things, not the negativity around: Leclerc to Ferrari F1
207.article_body: Ferrari F1 driver Charles Leclerc said the team needs to ignore criticism and focus on the job at hand. "I'm pretty sure that there's a lot of negativity around us...This is not going to help us go anywhere," said Leclerc. He added that F1 is a "very complex" sport and sometimes the criticism is "without any reasons".

208.title: K'taka govt withdraws circular to mobilise 6,500 students for PM's B'luru rally
208.article_body: Karnataka government's Pre University Education Department has withdrawn a circular directing colleges in Bengaluru to send students for PM Narendra Modi's rally in the city. Reacting to the circular which planned to mobilise 6,500 students, Congress spokesperson Nagaraj Yadav said, "Students should be in academic activity...not in rally." "What about their time for studying?" he added.

209.title: Indians are the largest foreign-born group in England, Wales: Data
209.article_body: Nearly one-sixth of the people living in England and Wales in 2021 were born outside the country, according to the census data. Indians constituted the largest group of people born outside England and Wales at 1.5%, followed by Poland (1.2%) and Pakistan (1%). In the UK, London was the region with the largest proportion of people born outside the country.

210.title: Economic reforms by Manmohan Singh gave new direction to India: Gadkari
210.article_body: Union Road Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari on Tuesday said the country is indebted to former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh for the economic reforms. Gadkari added that liberalisation policies implemented by Singh as finance minister in 1991 gave a new direction to India. "India needs a liberal economic policy with the intention to provide benefits to poor people," he further said.

211.title: Germany raids UBS offices in case involving Russian businessman
211.article_body: German police on Tuesday raided the offices of investment banking company UBS in connection with a money laundering case. The searches were linked to the same probe, involving a Russian businessman, that saw raids on a luxury yacht and more than 20 properties in September, prosecutors said. The subject of the investigation is believed to be Russian oligarch Alisher Usmanov.

212.title: European Union sanctions 19 more Myanmar officials
212.article_body: The European Union (EU) sanctioned 19 senior officials and armed forces personnel in Myanmar on Tuesday. The list includes the Foreign Economic Relations Minister, the Chief Justice, top military personnel and businessmen. These individuals are now banned from going to Europe and their assets have been frozen. With this, the EU in total has targeted 84 people and 11 'entities'.

213.title: Pakistan Police file FIR in Imran Khan's assassination bid
213.article_body: Pakistan's Punjab Police on Tuesday filed an FIR on the failed assassination attempt on former Prime Minister Imran Khan's life. The FIR was filed a day after Pakistan's apex court ordered the provincial police to register the case or face suo motu action. The detained attacker has been named the prime accused in the case.

214.title: Choosing Qatar to host WC was a mistake: Ex-FIFA President Blatter
214.article_body: FIFA's President at the time Sepp Blatter said picking Qatar to host the World Cup was a mistake 12 years ago. "It's a country that's too small...Thanks to the four votes of (then UEFA President Michel) Platini and his (UEFA) team, the World Cup went to Qatar," he said. Blatter added that he voted for the United States.

215.title: Don't visualise any problem from the BJP rebels: JP Nadda
215.article_body: BJP chief JP Nadda said that he doesn't visualise any problem from their party rebels who are contesting in the Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections. "When the campaign picks up, the voters understand that they have to vote for the party...Rebels will be further neutralised by the time of the election," Nadda said. However, Nadda admitted that the situation is unusual.

216.title: Winter session of Assam Legislative Assembly to start from Dec 20
216.article_body: According to a statement issued by the Assam Legislative Assembly Secretariat on Tuesday, the winter session of the Assembly will start from December 20. The session will be held at the Assembly Chamber in Dispur. As per the statement, Governor of Assam, Jagdish Mukhi, has summoned the session to meet at 9.30 am on December 20.

217.title: 50 middle school students fall ill after eating midday meal in Bihar
217.article_body: As many as 50 students of a middle school in Bihar's Bhojpur district fell ill after consuming midday meal on Tuesday, officials said. Many students complained of stomach ache and vomiting. The victims were admitted to hospital for treatment and their conditions are reportedly stable. Police said the school administration had given albendazole tablets to students after the meal.

218.title: Farcical: Imran Khan on FIR filed in assassination bid on him
218.article_body: Former Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan on Tuesday described the FIR registered on the assassination attempt on him as "farcical". The FIR was filed on Tuesday after Pakistan's apex court ordered the provincial police to register the case or face suo motu action. Khan said he would express his position through his lawyers in the case.

219.title: I was replaced in a show as I had short hair after chemotherapy: Lisa Ray
219.article_body: Actress Lisa Ray, in a conversation with Humans of Bombay, opened up about her battle with cancer and revealed she was replaced in a travel show as she had short hair after chemotherapy. "They wanted a girl with 'long' hair. It was heartbreaking," she added. "I once tried wearing a wig for a public event...I found it...ridiculous," Lisa said.

220.title: Governors being used to encroach upon state govt powers: Kerala CM
220.article_body: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan accused the central government of using Governors in non-BJP-ruled states to 'encroach upon the powers of state governments'. "In many states, horse-trading of elected representatives is going on," said Vijayan. He further claimed that attempts were also being made to "financially choke" such states.

221.title: ASI, CRPF constable arrested in J&K police sub-inspector recruitment scam
221.article_body: An assistant sub-inspector (ASI) of Jammu and Kashmir Police and a constable of the CRPF are among the four people arrested by the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) in the Jammu and Kashmir Police sub-inspector recruitment scam on Monday. So far, the CBI has arrested 13 people in the case, including security personnel and a teacher.

222.title: England need to win T20 World Cup to achieve greatness: Moeen Ali
222.article_body: All-rounder Moeen Ali said England needs to win more trophies to be considered a great limited-overs team. "It's important we start winning more as a team and as a country...Then we can call ourselves a top side," said Ali. He added that the team haven't performed well in the T20 World Cup so far and is hoping to correct it.

223.title: Armed group decamps with ₹20 lakh from Dera in Punjab's Hoshiarpur
223.article_body: Unidentified gunmen forcibly entered a dera and decamped with ₹20 lakh in cash in Punjab's Hoshiarpur on Tuesday. Around 45 people armed with pistols and sharp-edged weapons are reported to have broken into the dera. The group was led by Tarsem Singh and Satvir Singh, who are from Uttar Pradesh, said Deputy Superintendent of Police (Rural) Surinder Pal.

224.title: Man carries 3-yr-old's body for 65 kms on 2-wheeler after being refused ambulance
224.article_body: A video shows a man in Telangana's Khammam district carrying his three-year-old daughter's body on a two-wheeler after he was allegedly denied an ambulance by hospital staff. The child's parents were denied ambulance as there was no free ambulance service available at the time. The man carried his daughter's body for 65 kilometres as he couldn't afford a private ambulance.

225.title: Anand Marriage Act to be implemented in letter, spirit: Punjab CM
225.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Tuesday said the Anand Marriage Act, which seeks to give statutory recognition to Sikhs' 'Anand Karaj' marriage ceremony, will be implemented in letter and spirit. He said several states like Haryana and Tamil Nadu have already implemented the act. Mann pointed out that a notification to implement the act was issued in Punjab in 2016.

226.title: Boxer Nikhat Zareen recreates 'Saathiya Tune...' with Salman, shares video
226.article_body: CWG gold medallist Nikhat Zareen took to Twitter on Tuesday to share a video with Salman Khan. In the video, the boxer was seen recreating 'Saathiya Tune Kya Kiya' song with Salman. "Finallyyyyy intezar khatam hua (Finally, the wait is over) #fanmoment #dreamcometrue," Nikhat wrote. The song was a part of 'Love', a 1991 film which featured Salman and Revathi.

227.title: Wipro appoints Frederic Abecassis as BFSI head for Southeast Asia
227.article_body: IT company Wipro on Tuesday appointed Frederic Abecassis as the Head of Banking, Financial Services and Insurance (BFSI) Industry Sector, Southeast Asia. Prior to joining Wipro, Abecassis held various leadership roles with Capgemini Invent. According to Wipro, Abecassis, who is based in Hong Kong, will partner with and help clients achieve their core business and digital transformation goals.

228.title: UCC to be implemented throughout states: BJP chief JP Nadda
228.article_body: BJP chief JP Nadda said the Uniform Civil Code (UCC) will be implemented at the state level. Calling the UCC an important issue, he said the ruling party has to run the country 'delicately'. "We have taken this issue state by state and have included it in the Himachal Pradesh manifesto," Nadda said.

229.title: No pressure on Congress workers to join Bharat Jodo Yatra: Kamal Nath
229.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Congress President Kamal Nath said there was no pressure on party workers to participate in Rahul Gandhi's ongoing Bharat Jodo Yatra. "Despite that, all party workers will join it with their hearts," said Nath. He added that the Yatra did not have any political objective but was launched as "our cultural and constitutional institutions are in danger".

230.title: Will focus on sanity, not vanity if Congress wins Guj: Chidambaram
230.article_body: Former Finance Minister P Chidambaram said if the Congress comes to power in Gujarat, it won't focus on "vanity projects" like the bullet train or Central Vista project. "Every pie should be weighed and spent...You must spend only on sanity projects," said Chidambaram. He added that a government should focus on the needs of the poor like "jobs, houses, water".

231.title: Renault to split into 5 divisions, spin-off EV unit
231.article_body: French automaker Renault on Tuesday announced its plans to split its activities into five businesses. It'll spin-off its electric vehicles unit, codenamed Ampere, with a stock market listing. Further, its combustion-engines unit will be housed in a joint venture with Chinese rival Geely. Its other businesses will cover the Alpine sports car brand, financial services and new mobility products.

232.title: 3 people, including 2 children, drown after boat capsizes in UP
232.article_body: A boat carrying 20 people capsized in Uttar Pradesh, killing three people including two children, police said. UP CM Yogi Adityanath told officials to provide help to the affected families and District Magistrate Avinash Kumar announced ex-gratia of ₹4 lakh each to the relatives of the deceased. Among those on the boat, 13 people swam to safety.

233.title: ICC names 10 best catches in Super 12 stage of T20 World Cup 2022
233.article_body: ICC has named 10 best catches in the Super 12 stage of T20 World Cup 2022. It includes Netherlands' Roelof van der Merwe's catch to dismiss David Miller. Catches taken by England's Liam Livingstone, Jos Buttler and Adil Rashid also featured. Babar Azam, Rashid Khan,  Ashen Bandara, Glenn Phillips, Ryan Burl and Rilee Rossouw's catches were also included.

234.title: Lewis Hamilton becomes Brazil's honorary citizen, says 'I feel like now I'm one of you'
234.article_body: Seven-time Formula One world champion Lewis Hamilton has been made an honorary citizen of Brazil. Hamilton dedicated the honour to his boyhood idol, late Brazilian Formula One world champion Ayrton Senna.  "I feel like now I'm one of you," the Mercedes driver said in a session of Brazil's lower house of Congress.

235.title: Indian players to remain away from overseas leagues: IPL Chairman Arun Dhumal
235.article_body: New IPL Chairman Arun Dhumal has stated that contracted Indian players will remain away from overseas leagues. "This in principle is the decision of BCCI... As it is there is so much of cricket happening. Keeping in mind their overall well-being that decision has been taken. As of now we stick to that decision," he added.

236.title: 2 teens run over by train while taking selfie on tracks in Bengal
236.article_body: Two teenagers were run over by a local train while clicking a selfie on railway tracks in West Bengal's Howrah district, Government Railway Police said on Tuesday. The incident took place near Mahishrekha bridge between Kulgachia and Bagnan railway stations on Monday night. The bodies were recovered and handed over to their parents after post-mortem examination, an official said.

237.title: Elephant dies after getting electrocuted in Assam's Nagaon
237.article_body: An adult elephant died of electrocution in Assam's Nagaon district on Tuesday. The incident happened after the elephant strayed into a locality and came in contact with a high-voltage wire that was hanging low, forest officials said. The deceased elephant, which was first spotted by locals at Borholla village, was buried by forest officials with the help of locals.

238.title: 2 US police officers charged after car with handcuffed woman hit by train
238.article_body: Two police officers in US' Colorado state were charged with multiple offences on Monday for allegedly leaving a handcuffed woman in a patrol car parked on railway tracks, where it was struck by a freight train. Yareni Rios-Gonzalez (20) was seriously injured in the incident. She was placed in the car after being detained for an alleged road rage incident.

239.title: Brazil's Pedro proposes to girlfriend minutes after being selected for FIFA World Cup
239.article_body: Brazilian striker Pedro Guilherme proposed to his girlfriend minutes after being named in Brazil's squad for 2022 FIFA World Cup. The 25-year-old shared pictures after getting engaged and wrote, "God is so good, so grateful to God for having this woman in my life. Thank you for making me grow in every area most especially as a man of God."

240.title: Union Minister Anurag Thakur pushes bus to clear jam in Himachal, video surfaces
240.article_body: Union Sports Minister Anurag Thakur was seen pushing a bus that had broken down in the middle of the road in Himachal Pradesh's Bilaspur, causing a traffic jam. The minister was seen participating in efforts to clear the road after his convoy got stuck. Thakur, whose father is a former Himachal CM, is in the state for poll rallies.

241.title: Leslie Phillips, voice of Sorting Hat in 'Harry Potter' films, passes away
241.article_body: Leslie Phillips, the British actor who voiced the Sorting Hat in 'Harry Potter' films, passed away aged 98. His agent, Jonathan Lloyd, said that he died "peacefully at home" on Monday. Leslie's wife Zara said, "I've lost a wonderful husband and...public has lost a truly great showman." Leslie was also known for his roles in the 'Carry On' comedy films.

242.title: EU opens investigation into Microsoft's $69 bn Activision bid
242.article_body: European Union antitrust regulators opened an investigation into Microsoft's $69 billion bid for 'Call of Duty' maker Activision Blizzard. The regulatory commission said that the transaction may distort competition in the market and it is concerned that Microsoft may not provide access to Activision's console and PC video games. Microsoft announced the agreement to buy Activision in January.

243.title: PM Modi is popular in world, nobody has leadership qualities like him: Nadda
243.article_body: BJP chief JP Nadda said that PM Narendra Modi is popular across the world and nobody has leadership qualities like him. "There is no second thought that PM Modi is our most towering personality," Nadda said in an interview. He added, "It is our pride that he is our commander and PM Modi has personal bonding with Himachal Pradesh."

244.title: 27 girls missing from Rajasthan village, says NCPCR; orders probe
244.article_body: The National Commission for Protection of Child Rights (NCPCR) Chairperson Priyank Kanoongo said that a probe has been ordered over 27 girls who went missing from their village in Rajasthan. The village has been allegedly selling girls on government stamp papers. Kanoongo visited the village after a notice was issued to the Rajasthan government on the reported auctioning of girls.

245.title: 2 drug smugglers arrested in J&K's Udhampur, 27 kg poppy seized
245.article_body: Two inter-state drug smugglers were arrested on Tuesday in Jammu and Kashmir's Udhampur district and 27 kg of poppy was seized from their possession, officials said. The arrests were made after a truck was intercepted at Jakhani Chowk on the Jammu-Srinagar National Highway. Truck driver Sukhdev Singh and his accomplice Harpreet Singh were arrested.

246.title: MBBS, BDS seats reserved for children of terror victims in J&K
246.article_body: The Centre has decided to reserve seats in MBBS and BDS courses for the spouse and children of terrorist victims in Jammu and Kashmir. Seats will be reserved from the central pool for academic year 2022-23. Children whose both parents were killed by terrorists would get the first priority, followed by children of families whose sole bread earners were slain.

247.title: 2023-24 PL season to start on August 12, mid-season break in Jan 2024
247.article_body: The 2023-24 Premier League season will start on August 12 and will have a mid-season player break from January 13 to 20, 2024. "In keeping with commitments made to clubs this season...no two rounds in this period will take place within 48 hours of each other," said the league in a statement. The season will end on May 19, 2024.

248.title: Remove 50% reservation cap, hold nationwide caste census: Nitish
248.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar demanded that the cap of 50% on reservations be removed and a nationwide caste census be conducted in India. "The cap is depriving OBCs and EBCs (economically backward class) of opportunities in proportion to their population," said Kumar. He also welcomed the Supreme Court's decision to uphold the 10% reservation for the Economically Weaker Sections (EWS).

249.title: Ex-IPS officer launches Hindutva-based political party in Gujarat
249.article_body: Ex-IPS officer DG Vanzara on Tuesday launched a party called Praja Vijay Party (PVP), which will contest the upcoming Gujarat Assembly elections. Calling the PVP a "Hindutva party", Vanzara said, "People of Gujarat don't easily accept a non-Hindutva party. Only a Hindutva party can provide an alternative to the BJP." Notably, Vanzara was earlier acquitted in cases of extrajudicial killings.

250.title: Editors Guild calls Kerala Guv expelling journalists from press meet 'arbitrary act'
250.article_body: Editors Guild of India said Kerala Governor Arif Mohammed Khan expelling journalists of two news channels from a press conference in Kochi was an "arbitrary act". The Guild said it was "deeply disturbed" by this selective targeting of media channels by a person "who is supposed to be guardian of democratic values". "Media has right to be critical," it added.

251.title: Salman scrapped everything I shot on day 1 during Dabangg 2 shoot: Arbaaz
251.article_body: Actor Arbaaz Khan, who directed 'Dabangg 2', revealed he had 40 shots lined up on the first day of the shoot. He added, "Brother Salman Khan let me go by the book and do it. I thought, 'Wow, what an obedient actor'." Arbaaz revealed Salman scrapped everything they shot on the first day. "He decided to rattle me," Arbaaz stated.

252.title: I'm a darling of the people, BJP troubled by it: Delhi CM Kejriwal
252.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said that he was "the darling of the people" and BJP was 'troubled' by the love he was getting. "Before Punjab elections, PM said Kejriwal is a terrorist...Now, before Gujarat and the MCD polls, they are saying Kejriwal is corrupt," he said. Kejriwal added that he should be arrested if he is corrupt or a terrorist.

253.title: World's largest cryptocurrency exchange Binance to buy its rival FTX
253.article_body: Binance, the world's largest cryptocurrency exchange, has signed a non-binding letter of intent to acquire rival crypto exchange FTX. "This afternoon, FTX asked for our help. There's a significant liquidity crunch," Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao said, while FTX CEO Sam Bankman-Fried tweeted, "Things have come full circle." The deal was announced after a public feud between the two CEOs.

254.title: Sanjana Ganesan responds after troll says 'You aren't beautiful enough for Bumrah'
254.article_body: Sanjana Ganesan has responded to an Instagram user after the troll commented on one of her pictures. "[Ma'am] you are not that beautiful, how did you impress Jasprit Bumrah?" the troll had written. Replying to this, Ganesan commented, "Aur khud jo chappal jaisi shakal lekar ghoom rahe ho uska kya? (What about your chappal-like face?)"

255.title: People misunderstood my comment about not taking ex's calls: Ishaan
255.article_body: Actor Ishaan Khatter has said that people misunderstood his statement during 'Koffee With Karan 7' about not taking his ex-girlfriend's calls for two weeks. "People thought I was talking about my last relationship and that's not what that was. It was a relationship. I said it in context to a relationship and I don't regret it," he added.

256.title: 2 women killed in road accident in UP's Baghpat
256.article_body: Two women died after being hit by an unidentified vehicle on the Delhi-Saharanpur national highway in Baghpat, UP on Tuesday. The incident occurred when the deceased, Mukesh Devi (50) and Usha (63), were crossing the highway, police said. Both, Usha and Devi were residents of Katha village, police added. Notably, the accused driver is absconding.

257.title: By-election in UP's Khatauli on December 5 after MLA disqualified
257.article_body: The Election Commission on Tuesday said the by-election to the Khatauli Assembly seat in Uttar Pradesh will be held on December 5. The by-election was necessitated following BJP MLA Vikram Singh's conviction last month in a case connected with the 2013 Muzaffarnagar riots. Singh, who was sentenced to two years in jail, was also disqualified as a legislator.

258.title: Hinduism not a religion, it's a way of life: Former BJP MP Katti
258.article_body: A video of former BJP MP Ramesh Katti allegedly stating "Hinduism is not a religion" has gone viral. "Hinduism is a way of life...There is no Hindu faith. It is a usage," Katti reportedly says in the video. Earlier, Karnataka Congress leader Satish Jarkiholi claimed that the term 'Hindu' is of Persian origin and that the meaning "is very dirty".

259.title: US seeing no credible threat of midterms disruption: Official
259.article_body: US officials are not seeing any credible threats aimed at the country's voting machines or poll books during the midterm elections, a senior federal cybersecurity official told reporters on Tuesday. Notably, as per a report made public in 2019, US officials found evidence of Russian interference aimed at marring Hillary Clinton's chances against Donald Trump in the 2016 presidential elections.

260.title: Big B, Kamal Haasan, Rajinikanth: 'KGF' actor Yash on his inspiration
260.article_body: Actor Yash opened up about the actors he draws inspiration from. He named actors Shankar Nag, Ambareesh, Dr Rajkumar, Amitabh Bachchan, Rajinikanth, Kamal Haasan and Clint Eastwood. Yash, who featured in the 'KGF' franchise, will next be seen in the project that is tentatively named 'Yash 19'. The film will reportedly be directed by Narthan.

261.title: Kareena, Tabu & Kriti to star in Rhea Kapoor's comedy film 'The Crew'
261.article_body: Kareena Kapoor Khan, Tabu and Kriti Sanon are all set for their maiden collaboration in a film titled 'The Crew'. Produced by Ektaa Kapoor and Rhea Kapoor, it is said to be a comedy set against the backdrop of the airline industry. 'The Crew' will be directed by Rajesh Krishnan and it will go on floors in February 2023.

262.title: Anyone can lead Congress in Himachal, new leaders ready: Surjewala
262.article_body: Congress leader Randeep Singh Surjewala said that after election results are announced in Himachal Pradesh, anybody can lead the party there as a new line of leadership has emerged. Calling AICC General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi the face of elections in Himachal, he said that she will be spearheading the campaign. Elections in Himachal will be held on November 12.

263.title: Assam policeman, 3 doctors arrested for teen's rape-murder cover-up
263.article_body: Three government doctors and an ASP rank police officer have been arrested by the Assam CID for allegedly covering up the rape and murder of a 13-year-old domestic help, officials said on Tuesday. The victim's body was reportedly found hanging at an SSB jawan's house in the Darrang district in June. She was allegedly raped and murdered by the jawan.

264.title: Sunny Leone's pic appears on hall ticket of K'taka govt exam candidate, probe ordered
264.article_body: The hall ticket of a Karnataka Teacher Eligibility Test (TET) candidate carried the picture of actress Sunny Leone, following which an inquiry was ordered by the state education department. A picture of the improper hall ticket was shared on Twitter by Karnataka Congress social media chairperson BR Naidu. State School Education Minister BC Nagesh said candidates upload their own photos.

265.title: FIFA shares pic of Messi, Ronaldo, Neymar cutouts in river; says 'WC fever has hit Kerala'
265.article_body: FIFA took to its official Twitter account and shared a picture of cutouts of Cristiano Ronaldo, Neymar and Lionel Messi in a local river in Kerala. "FIFA World Cup fever has hit Kerala," FIFA wrote. The 2022 FIFA World Cup will begin on November 20 in Qatar. It'll be the first time that World Cup will take place in winter.

266.title: Unforgivable crime: Ex-K'taka CM on Lingayat seer rape allegations
266.article_body: Former Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa on Tuesday, while referring to Lingayat seer Shivamurthy Murugha Sharanaru, said, "The whole world today knows that he has committed an unforgivable offence." The seer has been accused of raping minor girls in Chitradurga. "Nobody had expected that he would stoop this low. Everyone should condemn this and he should be punished," Yediyurappa said.

267.title: Under ED probe, ex-Surat VP quits BJP alleging 'vindictive attitude'
267.article_body: PVS Sarma, a former Vice-President of BJP's Surat city unit, resigned on Tuesday alleging that he had been "treated badly with a vindictive attitude" since CR Paatil became the party's Gujarat President. According to Sarma, the BJP state unit under Paatil miserably failed to protect and support the karyakartas who worked tirelessly for the people and the party.

268.title: Kartik Aaryan & Luv Ranjan to reunite for Pyaar Ka Punchnama 3: Report
268.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan and filmmaker Luv Ranjan will reportedly reunite for 'Pyaar Ka Punchnama 3'. The duo previously worked together in the 2015 film 'Pyaar Ka Punchnama 2'. "They have been toying around with multiple ideas over the years...Luv will dive into developing this post the release of Ranbir Kapoor and Shraddha Kapoor's next in March," a source said.

269.title: Jagannath Temple body to pay ₹12 crore for illegal mining on its land
269.article_body: The National Green Tribunal (NGT) has ordered the Jagannath Temple administration to pay ₹12 crore to the Odisha government for allowing illegal stone quarrying on land belonging to the temple in Khordha district. The administration has been asked to deposit the money with Khordha District Collector for restitution, reclamation and renovation of the excavated areas within the next four months.

270.title: Rahul staying away from Himachal due to fear of defeat: Prasad
270.article_body: BJP leader Ravi Shankar Prasad said Rahul Gandhi is staying away from campaigning in Himachal Pradesh to 'avoid responsibility for Congress' defeat'. "Rahul Gandhi and Sonia Gandhi are not coming because they understand what the result is going to be," said Prasad. He added that Congress lost the bypoll in Telangana despite the Bharat Jodo Yatra crossing the state.

271.title: Quona Capital announces close of 3rd fund at $332 mn
271.article_body: Venture capital firm Quona Capital has announced the close of its third fund at $332 million which it will use to continue investing in various emerging markets such as India and Southeast Asia. At its close, the fund exceeded its target of $250 million. The Washington DC-headquartered firm has invested in Indian startups such as ZestMoney, IndiaMart among others.

272.title: Pocket FM clocks $25 mn annualised revenue run-rate, forays into US
272.article_body: Audio streaming platform Pocket FM announced its international expansion and entry into the United States market. The company has exceeded $25 million ARR (Annualised Revenue Run-rate) as recorded until October 2022. With the introduction of micro-payment, the platform has registered a 10X revenue growth during the fourth year of operations with 500,000+ monthly transactions, the startup said.

273.title: Adidas appoints ex-Puma chief Bjorn Gulden as new CEO
273.article_body: Adidas appointed former Puma head Bjorn Gulden as its next CEO effective January 1, 2023. Current CEO Kasper Rorsted will step down on Friday, Adidas said. This came after Adidas recently terminated its Yeezy partnership following antisemitic remarks from the rapper-designer Ye, formerly known as Kanye West. Yeezy accounted for nearly half of the company's total profits in recent years.

274.title: MK Stalin calls all-party meet on November 12 over EWS verdict
274.article_body: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin called for an all-party meeting on November 12 over the Supreme Court's verdict providing 10% reservation for economically weaker sections (EWS). The meet will be held at the secretariat and two representatives from each legislative party will be invited to participate. Stalin called the verdict a setback in the struggle for social justice.

275.title: US photographer treks 165 km to capture images of snow leopard in Nepal, pics viral
275.article_body: US-based photographer Kittiya Pawlowski, while sharing an Instagram post, revealed she undertook a journey of 165 km on foot to reach Khumbu Valley in Nepal in an attempt to photograph  snow leopards. "After walking through Earth's most forbidding terrain, lung-starving altitudes—this was the most...rewarding set of photos I've ever taken," she wrote. "This is stunning," a comment read.

276.title: Video shows in-laws beating woman for breaking husband's leg in MP
276.article_body: A video has surfaced showing a woman being assaulted by her in-laws for allegedly breaking her husband's leg in MP's Gwalior. In the video, eight-nine people can be seen kicking and punching the woman. The woman has accused six people, including her husband, of assault and torture and the police have registered an FIR against both sides.

277.title: 'RRR' is most well-executed, spectacular movie: 'The Lunchbox' director
277.article_body: Filmmaker Ritesh Batra, who directed the 2013 film 'The Lunchbox', took to Twitter and praised SS Rajamouli's 'RRR'. He tweeted, "'RRR' is the most well-executed, spectacular movie I've seen in a long long time!" He added that the film is a must-watch in a theatre. "Believe the hype! Rajamouli makes us so proud," Ritesh added.

278.title: 'Mister Mummy' release postponed, film to clash with 'Drishyam 2'
278.article_body: The release date of Riteish Deshmukh and Genelia Deshmukh-starrer 'Mister Mummy' has been postponed. The film, which was earlier scheduled to release on November 11, will now arrive in theatres on November 18. The Shaad Ali directorial will clash with Ajay Devgn and Tabu's thriller 'Drishyam 2' at the box office.

279.title: Ghazal Alagh, Namita on Forbes' 20 powerful businesswomen in Asia list
279.article_body: On Forbes Asia's 20 powerful businesswomen list, three Indians, whose businesses soared despite COVID-19, were featured. Chairperson of Steel Authority of India Ltd (SAIL), Soma Mondal; Executive Director (India Business) of Emcure Pharma, Namita Thapar and Co-founder & Chief Innovation Officer of Honasa Consumer, Ghazal Alagh are on the list. Forbes said that the women are newcomers to the list.

280.title: Body shaming starts at home, mom constantly told me to lose weight: Sonakshi
280.article_body: Actress Sonakshi Sinha in an interview recalled how she faced body shaming at home and said her mother constantly asked her to lose weight. "When somebody was...saying that to you, the rebellious kid in me would always do...opposite and...the day my mother stopped telling me that's when it actually struck me...I need to do something about my weight," she added.

281.title: 'Spunky' schoolgirl confronts K'taka IAS officer for extra library hrs
281.article_body: A schoolgirl on Monday asked Karnataka IAS officer LK Atheeq to extend timings of gram panchayat community libraries to eight hours per day. The Additional Chief Secretary of Karnataka rural development department shared a video of the incident. The officer tweeted, "When I visited a GP library...I was confronted by this spunky young girl, ready with a petition she wrote."

282.title: Journalist killed in Kenya was targeted, claims Pak minister
282.article_body: Pakistan's Interior Minister, Rana Sanaullah, said on Tuesday evidence suggested that Pakistani journalist Arshad Sharif, who was shot dead in Kenya, was the victim of a targeted killing. The incident occurred on October 23 on the outskirts of Nairobi. The vehicle Sharif was travelling in came under fire from police as it drove through a roadblock, Kenyan police had said.

283.title: Team India players dine at 'British Raj' restaurant ahead of T20 WC semi against England
283.article_body: Team India players and their partners dined at 'British Raj' restaurant in Adelaide ahead of their T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final against England, which will take place on Thursday. "Three days in Adelaide is like bliss...It was a team bonding exercise also and a chance to completely unwind,"   a senior BCCI official told PTI.

284.title: Suryakumar's diet built on a 5-point agenda, cheat meals are rare: Dietitian
284.article_body: Dietitian Shweta Bhatia, who worked with Suryakumar Yadav on his diet for the past year, said the cricketer's diet was built on a five-point agenda. His diet was planned to help him boost performance, maintain body fat, remain cognitively alert/energetic, reduce the need to refuel constantly and promote recovery. Cheat meals are a rarity and planned strategically, Bhatia said.

285.title: Shivnarine Chanderpaul, 2 others inducted into ICC Hall of Fame
285.article_body: ICC on Tuesday announced three new additions to the ICC Hall of Fame, with former West Indies captain Shivnarine Chanderpaul, former Pakistan spinner Abdul Qadir and former England Women captain Charlotte Edwards being the latest inductees. Chanderpaul scored 20,988 runs for West Indies between 1994 and 2015, while Qadir took 368 international wickets. Charlotte scored 10,273 international runs.

286.title: Centre releases ₹7,183 crore as revenue deficit grant to 14 states
286.article_body: Ministry of Finance on Monday released the eighth monthly instalment of Post Devolution Revenue Deficit (PDRD) Grant of ₹7,183.42 crore to 14 states, including Andhra Pradesh, Rajasthan, Assam and Punjab. With this, the amount released in FY23 stands at ₹57,467.33 crore. The Fifteenth Finance Commission has recommended a total PDRD grant of ₹86,201 crore for the FY23.

287.title: TN targets ₹75,000-cr investment in aerospace, defence over 10 years
287.article_body: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin on Tuesday released the Aerospace and Defence Industrial Policy, 2022, which targets nearly ₹75,000 crore investments in the next ten years. The policy aims to provide enhanced support to the micro, small and medium enterprises sector and startups engaged in the two sectors. The government plans to create over one lakh jobs.

288.title: Karnataka cabinet expansion likely after Gujarat polls: CM Bommai
288.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said the cabinet expansion in the state is likely after the Gujarat Assembly elections due in December. "Cabinet expansion...I have already spoken...our leadership is a bit busy with the Gujarat elections, as soon as it is over they will call me (for discussions)," Bommai said. The cabinet expansion was reportedly going to fill six vacant posts.

289.title: Madrassa students should become officers, not Maulvis: UP Minister
289.article_body: UP minister Dharam Pal Singh said Madrassa students in the state will be taught math and science, among other subjects, so that they become "officers" instead of "maulvis". Singh said he is following the PM's vision of 'Quran in one hand and laptop in the other'. He added that schools and hospitals will be built by vacating Waqf Board land.

290.title: I-T Dept raids 2 J'khand Cong MLAs, detects ₹100 cr unaccounted transactions
290.article_body: Income Tax Department has detected unaccounted transactions worth over ₹100 crore after it raided Jharkhand Congress MLAs, Kumar Jaimangal and Pradeep Yadav, and their alleged associates. The Department also said that 50 premises in Jharkhand, Bihar, Gurugram (Haryana) and West Bengal were covered during searches. Based on preliminary analysis, concerned people engaged in tax evasion, it added.

291.title: No one has talked to me about it: Rajkummar Rao on 'Stree 2'
291.article_body: Actor Rajkummar Rao, who featured in the 2018 film 'Stree', has said that a sequel to the film should be made as it was "a good and hit film". "I have not given any official statement regarding the film because no one has talked to me about it yet," he added. This comes after actress Shraddha Kapoor confirmed 'Stree 2'.

292.title: Over 42 million early votes cast in run-up to US midterm elections
292.article_body: More than 42 million Americans cast early votes in the run-up to Tuesday's midterm elections, the US Elections Project said on Monday. According to the website, 39.1 million early votes had been cast by the same point in the 2018 midterms. The US went to polls on Tuesday to elect 435 House of Representatives members and one-third of the Senate.

293.title: Rohit is big-match player, likes playing against Eng: Kaif ahead of SF
293.article_body: Ahead of the India-England semifinal match on Thursday, ex-cricketer Mohammad Kaif said that Indian skipper Rohit Sharma is a "big-match player" and likes playing against England. "I will not be surprised at all if Rohit scores big in that semifinal...whenever there is pressure, he plays a match-winning knock...The next match is the biggest one for Rohit as captain," Kaif said.

294.title: Elon Musk considering putting all of Twitter behind a paywall: Reports
294.article_body: Elon Musk is reportedly considering putting all of Twitter behind a paywall in an effort to monetise the site. Musk discussed the idea with tech investor David Sacks, who's helping him at Twitter, in recent meetings, Platformer reported. One such plan might allow all users to browse Twitter for free only for a limited amount of time per month.

295.title: 2 women beaten, their private parts burnt for being in lesbian relationship in WB
295.article_body: Two women, who are in a lesbian relationship, were beaten and their private parts were burnt with hot rods by three men in West Bengal's Murshidabad district. One of the accused has been arrested, while search is on to arrest the rest, police said. Two of the accused are relatives of the victims, as per reports.

296.title: Had pleasure of being in Arshdeep's company in Punjab Kings: Andy Flower
296.article_body: Ex-Zimbabwe skipper Andy Flower said that the world has known less about Indian pacer Arshdeep Singh. "I had the pleasure of being in his (Arshdeep) company when I was with Punjab Kings (PBKS) and he was a youngster coming through," Flower said. "You could always see his potential, not only in his physicality...but in his attitude," the 54-year-old ex-cricketer added.

297.title: INC means 'I need chori': BJP on Congress using KGF music in Yatra
297.article_body: Criticising Congress for illegally using 'KGF: Chapter 2' music during 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', BJP's Shehzad Poonawalla said, "Once a thief, always a thief". "INC does not stand for Indian National Congress," he said, adding that it stands for "I need chori". On Monday, a Bengaluru court ordered Twitter to temporarily block the accounts of Congress and Bharat Jodo Yatra.

298.title: Demonetisation was move by 'PayPM' for billionaire friends: Rahul
298.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday criticised PM Narendra Modi over demonetisation, saying it was a deliberate move by 'PayPM' to ensure that two-three of his billionaire friends monopolise India's economy. Congress' Gourav Vallabh, on the sixth anniversary of demonetisation, called it the "death anniversary of the Indian economy", adding that it was independent India's greatest loot.

299.title: K'taka HC stays order to block Congress, Bharat Jodo Yatra Twitter handles
299.article_body: The Karnataka High Court on Tuesday set aside a trial court's order to block the Indian National Congress (INC) and Bharat Jodo Yatra's Twitter handles over the alleged unauthorised use of music from the film 'KGF: Chapter 2'. The order is subject to Congress party "taking down the offending material" from social media before noon on Wednesday, the HC said.

300.title: 54-year-old woman dies after being run over by Vande Bharat Express in Gujarat
300.article_body: A 54-year-old woman died after being run over by Mumbai-bound Vande Bharat Express train near Anand Railway Station in Gujarat on Tuesday, Railway Police said. The victim, identified as Beatrice Archibald Peter, was crossing the track when the accident took place at 4.37 pm, an official said. The official added that the matter is under investigation.

301.title: Samantha will emerge victorious in her battle with myositis: Mukundan
301.article_body: Actor Unni Mukundan, who will feature in 'Yashoda' alongside Samantha Ruth Prabhu, has said that the actress will emerge victorious in her battle against myositis. "She is very hardworking and committed. She never spoke about her health or anything related to it and it comes as a shocker to me," he further added. Samantha revealed about myositis on Instagram.

302.title: Shot for song 'Chhori' when I was down with 102-degree fever: Nikki
302.article_body: 'Bigg Boss 14' fame Nikki Tamboli has revealed that she shot for her upcoming music video 'Chhori' when she was down with 102-degree fever. "But I kept going as I am very passionate when it comes to my work and my love for dance," she added. Nikki further said shooting for 'Chhori' was a memorable experience for her.

303.title: Probe launched after girl confined for over 7 years freed in Germany
303.article_body: German prosecutors have launched an investigation into the case of an eight-year-old girl who was allegedly kept locked in a room by her mother and grandparents for more than seven years. The girl reportedly showed no signs of abuse or malnourishment. However, she was "barely able to climb stairs on her own or navigate uneven ground".

304.title: 10-time MLA Mohansinh Rathava quits Congress ahead of Gujarat Assembly polls
304.article_body: Mohansinh Rathava, a 10-time Congress MLA from Gujarat's Chhota Udaipur, has quit the party ahead of Gujarat Assembly elections. Rathava was reportedly upset over Congress' inaction regarding the elections and is likely to join BJP. He had earlier said that he will not be contesting the upcoming elections as "the youth should get chance to represent" Chhota Udaipur.

305.title: 'Kantara' is also my film: Yash after host mistakenly says it's his film
305.article_body: During an event, Yash was asked about the success of the Kannada film 'Kantara'. While asking the question, the host said, "As we speak, Kantara, your new film...not your film but a Kannada film is making waves." Reacting to this, Yash said, "Sir, 'Kantara' is also my film. You said it's not my film but it is my film also."

306.title: Ishaan says Mira Rajput is the 'most complaining' member of the family
306.article_body: Ishaan Khatter, on being asked about the most complaining member of his family, named Mira Rajput Kapoor, the wife of Shahid Kapoor. "She complains to me all the time. She's like 'you haven't picked up your shoes...you have come 10 minutes late or something', so in that way, in a cute way. Not in any other way," Ishaan added.

307.title: India's first-ever private rocket built by Hyderabad startup to launch next week
307.article_body: India's first privately-built rocket Vikram-S, made by Hyderabad-based space-tech startup Skyroot Aerospace, will be launched between November 12 and November 16, the company announced. The launch window has been notified by authorities and the final date will be decided based on weather conditions, Skyroot CEO Pawan Chandana said. The launch will take place from ISRO's launchpad at Sriharikota.

308.title: Sloth bear tranquillised after attacking 3 men in TN dies after release
308.article_body: A 10-year-old female sloth bear, that was tranquillised by Tamil Nadu Forest Department officials in the foothills of the Western Ghats in Tenkasi district after it attacked three men, died a day after it was released in the wild. According to the officials, the bear died due to a lung infection. The injured villagers are undergoing treatment, Tenkasi Collector said.

309.title: Why is today's lunar eclipse called a Beaver Blood Moon eclipse?
309.article_body: Tuesday's total lunar eclipse got its name from Algonquian languages once spoken by Native Americans in the New England territory. It coincided with what they called the 'Beaver Moon' – a moniker for the November full Moon. As Earth casts shadow completely on the Moon, it dims the Moon's colour, giving it a reddish hue, hence the term "Blood Moon".

310.title: Masai School raises $10 mn, Mithali Raj & Bhaichung Bhutia join as investors
310.article_body: Masai School, a Bengaluru-based jobtech startup, has secured $10 million in Series B funding led by Omidyar Network India. The round also saw participation from former India women's cricket captain Mithali Raj and ex-Indian men's football team captain Bhaichung Bhutia, as investors and partners. The funding will enable Masai to launch two new course categories, 'MasaiX.' and 'Scholar Program'.

311.title: Offender arrested in Hyd for sale of fake educational certificates
311.article_body: A habitual offender was arrested in Hyderabad on Tuesday for indulging in the sale of fake educational certificates. Muqtar Ahmed, who used to con people on various pretexts, was taken into custody under the Preventive Detention Act. He and his associates, Kaleemuddin and Mohammed Feroze, used to create fake certificates and sell them to customers for large amounts of money.

312.title: Nigerian arrested with banned drugs worth ₹10 lakh in Navi Mumbai
312.article_body: A 42-year-old Nigerian national was arrested in Navi Mumbai for allegedly possessing banned drugs worth ₹10.3 lakh. The arrest happened after the  Anti-Narcotics Cell (ANC) of the Navi Mumbai Police raided premises in Vashi last weekend and seized 130 gm of Methaqualone from the Nigerian man, officials said. A case was registered under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act.

313.title: Hyd's NIMS to hold interim selection for MHM course on November 17
313.article_body: The Nizam's Institute of Medical Sciences (NIMS) in Hyderabad will hold a provisional selection of candidates for Masters in Hospital Management (MHM) course on November 17. Dean Dr N Bheerappa said the selection procedure is scheduled from 10 am onwards at the NIMS campus. Candidates whose names appear on the merit list should report with their certificates and hall ticket.

314.title: People I grew up with were cheering police: Guj man on being flogged
314.article_body: One of the Muslim men, who were tied to a pole and flogged allegedly by police personnel in Gujarat's Kheda last month, said, "People I grew up with watched and seemed to enjoy it as if it was entertainment." "They were cheering, laughing and chanting Jai Shri Ram while the policemen were humiliating us," the 48-year-old victim added.

315.title: Delhi students protest as funds not released for scholarship scheme
315.article_body: Beneficiaries under the Delhi government's coaching centre scholarship scheme protested outside the Department of SC/ST Welfare over non-payment of dues. The Jai Bhim Mukhyamantri Pratibha Vikas Yojana aims to train students from ST, SC, OBC and EWS categories for competitive exams. As funding for the scheme was not released, students said their monthly stipend of ₹2,500 was also withheld.

316.title: Dentist charged for throwing 4-yr-old daughter off B'luru building
316.article_body: Bengaluru Police filed a 193-page charge sheet against a dentist for allegedly throwing his four-year-old daughter off a building in August this year. According to reports, the accused was allegedly unhappy because of the medical condition of her daughter, due to which she had to sacrifice her professional life. She also tried leaving her daughter on an Orissa-bound train.

317.title: Delhi Capitals to release Shardul Thakur, four others ahead of IPL 2023: Reports
317.article_body: Delhi Capitals will release five players ahead of player retention deadline on November 15, PTI reported. The players include bowling all-rounder Shardul Thakur, wicketkeeper-batters KS Bharat and Tim Seifert, and batters Mandeep Singh and Ashwin Hebbar, PTI added. Thakur, who was bought by DC for ₹10.75 crore, took 15 wickets in IPL 2022 and had an economy rate of 9.79.

318.title: Who is Eugen Rochko, the coder who built Twitter rival Mastodon?
318.article_body: Eugen Rochko, the 29-year-old coder behind Twitter rival Mastodon, moved to Germany from Russia with his family when he was 11. He did B.Sc in computer science from a public university in Germany and launched Mastodon in 2016 when he was still studying. "The idea behind Mastodon is that online communication shouldn't be beholden to one private company," he says.

319.title: India is a very talented team, they will win T20 World Cup: ABD
319.article_body: Ex-South African skipper AB de Villiers said that India is a very talented team and they will win the ongoing T20 World Cup in Australia. "Everyone is playing well. Suryakumar Yadav and Virat Kohli are in great form. Rohit Sharma hasn't had his best of runs, but he will come into the party when it matters the most," he said.

320.title: Our bowlers have been outstanding throughout T20 WC: Williamson
320.article_body: New Zealand skipper Kane Williamson said their bowlers have been outstanding throughout the T20 World Cup 2022. Ahead of the semifinal match against Pakistan, Williamson said that they will have to adjust to the given conditions. "[In] the first game...here (SCG), the wicket was a very good one...Then the second time we played here it had changed," he added.

321.title: He absolutely murdered me before I got him out: Moeen Ali on Suryakumar's T20I hundred
321.article_body: Recalling Suryakumar Yadav's 117(55) against England, all-rounder Moeen Ali said, "He absolutely murdered me before I got him out." "He played amazingly well, some of the shots he played were some of the best I have ever seen," Ali added. "Thankfully, he was tired when I got him out...that's how I got him, I think," he stated.

322.title: Ex-serviceman kidnapped from Delhi, family gets 'sar tan se juda' threat
322.article_body: An ex-serviceman was kidnapped from Delhi's Sultanpuri area on Monday. After the victim, Rajendra Prasad, didn't return from work on Monday, his family tried calling him but the calls were disconnected several times. Prasad's family later received a message with a logo of Popular Front of India saying, "Sar tan se juda (head will be severed) in Ajmer via Pakistan."

323.title: It will happen soon: Arbaaz on film with brothers Salman and Sohail
323.article_body: Arbaaz Khan, when asked if he is planning to collaborate with brothers Salman Khan and Sohail Khan on a film, said, "There's a big possibility of that." "Right now, we're all engaged in our own things. But there will be a time when...[we'll] come together for something. And that might not be too late. It'll be quite soon," he added.

324.title: DU receives 1,000 applications for mid-entry window
324.article_body: The Delhi University (DU) has received over 1,000 applications in its mid-entry window to the varsity through the Common Seat Allocation System. Through the mid-entry window, candidates, who failed to apply before, get another chance to apply. The window was open from November 5 to 7. In total, DU offered around 70,000 undergraduate seats for admission this year.

325.title: AIMIM seeks permission to celebrate Tipu Jayanti at Idgah Maidan
325.article_body: All India Majlis-e-Ittehadul Muslimeen (AIMIM) and some Dalit organisations have sought permission from the municipal corporation to celebrate Tipu Jayanti at the Idgah Maidan in Karnataka's Hubballi. Meanwhile, Sri Ram Sena has also submitted a memorandum seeking permission to celebrate Kanakadasa Jayanti there. Earlier, the state high court allowed Ganesh Chaturthi celebrations at the ground.

326.title: Stray dog gets stuck on middle of B'luru Metro track, rescued
326.article_body: A stray dog, which was stuck on a Bengaluru Metro track, was immediately rescued by an animal rescue team. The electricity on the track was turned off immediately and the engineering team of Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited (BMRCL) was alerted soon after a Twitter user complained of the dog being stuck.

327.title: US aid worker shot dead in Baghdad: Iraqi officials
327.article_body: A US aid worker living in Baghdad was purportedly shot dead in the Iraqi capital on Monday, as per two police officials. The man was driving with his wife and child when a car cut him off and assailants in another car opened fire on him, the officials said. The motive behind the killing was not immediately clear, they added.

328.title: US hopes India will benefit from Russian oil price cap: US Treasury Secy
328.article_body: India will "benefit" from the proposed price cap on Russian oil, US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said ahead of her visit to India this week. "Our hope would be that India would take advantage of this price cap, though its firms are bargaining with Russia," Yellen said. "We want to make sure...Russia doesn't profit unduly from the war," Yellen added.

329.title: DeFi startup Flint moves out funds from crypto exchange FTX
329.article_body: Sequoia-backed decentralised finance startup Flint has "moved out" its funds from cryptocurrency exchange FTX. Bengaluru-based Flint told its users, "Given the situation with FTX...we want to ensure that your fund is safe and in order to do that, we have moved out all our funds from FTX safely." Flint allows users to earn up to 13% annually on deposited funds.

330.title: 62-year-old woman dies after falling into open manhole in Virar
330.article_body: A 62-year-old woman died after she accidentally fell into an open manhole in Virar, Maharashtra on Monday. The deceased, Kamlaben Shah, left her house to go to a local temple but didn't return and her body was found in the evening. A teenager informed of seeing a hand coming out of the water of the manhole, Kamlaben's husband Gulabchand said.

331.title: Ready to be hanged if my allegations are proved wrong: Conman Sukesh to Kejriwal
331.article_body: After alleging he gave money to AAP chief and Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal in exchange for a Rajya Sabha seat, conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar made new allegations. He said AAP's Satyendar Jain asked for money for the party during Punjab and Goa polls. "Kejriwal Ji, if any of my raised issues...turn out to be wrong...I'm ready to be hanged," he added.

332.title: Zoho crosses $1 bn in revenue, to double investments in AI
332.article_body: Chennai-based software-as-a-service (SaaS) firm Zoho announced that it has crossed $1 billion in revenue with India leading the growth and the regional annual revenue increasing by 77% in 2021. "No one has built a billion-dollar product company in India," CEO and Co-Founder Sridhar Vembu said. Zoho also announced that it will double investment into technologies like blockchain and AI.

333.title: Armenia & Azerbaijan participate in US-mediated peace talks
333.article_body: The foreign ministers of Azerbaijan and Armenia have met in Washington to participate in US-mediated peace talks, a week after Russian President Vladimir Putin hosted a similar summit. US Secretary of State Antony Blinken said, "The United States is committed to the peace negotiations." Armenia and Azerbaijan have fought two wars (1991 and 2020) over the territory of Nagorno-Karabakh.

334.title: 7 arrested in China as residents resist COVID-19 restrictions
334.article_body: Seven people have been arrested in northeastern China after residents clashed with the police over enforcing strict COVID-19 restrictions. The arrests come as China records new COVID-19 cases daily, with Guangzhou city reporting 2,230 cases on Tuesday. China has maintained a "zero-COVID" policy, according to which quarantines, lockdowns and near-daily tests are compulsory.

335.title: Seems unwarranted: KTR on Hyderabad's Nizam College hostel issue
335.article_body: Telangana minister KT Rama Rao (KTR) on Tuesday took to Twitter to address the issue of non-allotment of rooms to undergraduate students of Hyderabad's Nizam College in the new girls' hostel on the campus. "This situation seems unwarranted," he tweeted. He added, "[I] request [state Education Minister Sabitha Indra Reddy] to kindly intervene and address the issue."

336.title: Death anniversary of Indian economy: Congress on demonetisation
336.article_body: Taking a jibe at the Centre on the sixth anniversary of demonetisation, Congress on Tuesday called it "the death anniversary of the Indian economy". Congress leader Gourav Vallabh called demonetisation "independent India's greatest organised loot", adding that he wants PM Narendra Modi to tell the nation if he considers the move as his epic failure.

337.title: BJP planned Sena leader Sudhir Suri's murder to defame AAP: MP
337.article_body: Sangrur MP Simranjit Singh Mann has claimed that BJP and RSS planned Shiv Sena leader Sudhir Suri's murder to defame AAP. He said that BJP did this to gain sympathy votes, adding that BJP's plan was to defame AAP ahead of the Assembly polls in Himachal Pradesh and Gujarat. A Sikh named Sandeep Singh has been accused of killing Suri.

338.title: TV host Whoopi Goldberg quits Twitter after Musk's takeover, calls it 'too messy'
338.article_body: American TV host Caryn Elaine Johnson, known professionally as Whoopi Goldberg, quit Twitter after it was bought by Elon Musk. "It's been a little over a week since Elon Musk took over Twitter and this place is too messy," she said. "I'm tired of now having certain kinds of attitudes blocked now getting back on," she added.

339.title: Feared my character in 'Four More...' would be hated: Maanvi Gagroo
339.article_body: Actress Maanvi Gagroo said her character Siddhi was the most loved character after season two of her show 'Four More Shots Please!' Maanvi said she didn't agree with Siddhi being "annoying and erratic" after her father's death. "I feared...now, she would be hated. While shooting, I hated her...the makers made me believe...it'll all come together in the end," she added.

340.title: China playing 'aggressive games': Trudeau on poll interference claim
340.article_body: Canadian PM Justin Trudeau on Monday accused China of playing "aggressive games" with democracies and targeting Canadian institutions. This came following a report by Global News that claimed Beijing had funded a "clandestine network" of at least 11 candidates in the 2019 Canadian federal elections. Responding to the allegations, China said that it has "no interest" in Canada's internal affairs.

341.title: Incredible lie: Greek PM on report claiming he wiretapped ministers
341.article_body: Greek PM Kyriakos Mitsotakis on Monday termed a report by left-wing newspaper Documento about him wiretapping his own ministers as an "incredible lie". He said the report lacked "the faintest proof" against him. The said report claimed that more than 30 individuals, including ministers and business people, had been under state surveillance via Israeli spyware, Predator.

342.title: SRK, Salman, Hrithik to be part of Aditya Chopra's spy universe: Report
342.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan, Salman Khan and Hrithik Roshan will reportedly be cast in a film together as a part of producer Aditya Chopra's spy universe. "The paths of SRK's character from 'Pathaan', Salman's character from 'Tiger' franchise and Hrithik's character from 'War' will constantly cross to build up the grand finale of the spy universe," a source added.

343.title: PM Modi unveils logo, theme and website of India's G20 presidency
343.article_body: PM Narendra Modi unveiled the logo, theme and website for India's presidency of the G20. The logo, created with the four colours of India's national flag, shows the earth sitting atop a lotus, and the seven petals in the logo signify the coming together of seven continents at G20. The theme is 'Vasudhaiva Kutumbakam: One Earth, One Family, One Future'.

344.title: Car stunt by drunk men at 2 am kills 50-year-old in Gurugram, video surfaces
344.article_body: A 50-year-old man was killed after drunk men hit him with their SUV while performing stunts in Gurugram, the police said. Videos of the incident, which took place at around 2 am on Sunday, show the men drifting their car in an area outside a liquor shop. "Seven accused have been arrested and two cars have been impounded," said police.

345.title: It worked in our favour, we'll keep it going: Jaishankar on Russian oil import amid war
345.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said in Moscow that India-Russia relations have 'worked in India's favour' by facilitating oil imports. "If it works to my advantage, I would like to keep that going," said Jaishankar. "As the world's third-largest consumer of oil and gas, it is our fundamental obligation to ensure Indian consumers have the best possible access," he added.

346.title: A character that changed everything for me: Yami on 3 yrs of 'Bala'
346.article_body: Actress Yami Gautam took to Instagram on Tuesday to share a post marking three years of 'Bala'. "Looking back with a heart full of love and gratitude for the film and Pari Mishra! A character that changed everything for me ever since," she wrote. Directed by Amar Kaushik, the comedy film also featured Ayushmann Khurrana and Bhumi Pednekar.

347.title: Will construct ropeways, cable railway system in Himachal: Nitin Gadkari
