347.article_body: Ahead of the Himachal Pradesh polls, Union Road Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari promised to make more ropeways, cable railway system and tunnels in the state. "Constructing roads is difficult here…if we can connect these mountains through the electric transport system, [this] will ease...travel and improve connectivity," said Gadkari. The state will go to polls on November 12.

348.title: First teaser poster of Allu Arjun's 'Pushpa 2' to be out soon: Report
348.article_body: Actor Allu Arjun has reportedly shot for the teaser poster of 'Pushpa: The Rule - Part 2', which the makers are planning to release by the end of November. Reportedly, Allu Arjun will fly to Bangkok to shoot the film's first schedule. As per a report, during the 15-day long schedule, the actor will be shooting some fight sequences.

349.title: Nana Patekar to play lawyer in debut web series 'Laal Batti': Reports
349.article_body: Nana Patekar is set to make his web series debut with a show titled 'Laal Batti', as per reports. He'll reportedly play the role of a lawyer in the show, which will be directed by Prakash Jha. Meghna Malik, known for shows like 'Na Aana Iss Des Laado' and 'Bandish Bandits', has reportedly been roped in to play his wife.

350.title: India advises return to dialogue, diplomacy: Jaishankar in Russia amid Ukraine war
350.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Tuesday commented on the Ukraine war during a press conference with Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov and said, "India strongly advocates a return to dialogue and diplomacy." He said the consequences of the war are visible. "The global economy is...too interdependent for significant conflict anywhere not to have major [impacts] elsewhere," he added.

351.title: Varun Dhawan's 'Bhediya' to premiere at IFFI Goa
351.article_body: Varun Dhawan's 'Bhediya' will premiere at the International Film Festival of India (IFFI), which is to be held in Goa from November 20-28. As per a source, Varun, along with Kriti Sanon, Abhishek Banerjee and director Amar Kaushik, will attend the event. Apart from 'Bhediya', 'The Storyteller' and 'India Lockdown' will also premiere at the festival.

352.title: Rahul should apologise: MP Minister on Cong leader's 'Hindu' remark
352.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Narottam Mishra on Tuesday demanded an apology from Congress leader Rahul Gandhi over Karnataka Congress leader Satish Jarkiholi's remark on the word 'Hindu'. "Rahul Gandhi should apologise for the derogatory remarks...I will write a letter to him to clarify what Congress thinks about 'Hindu' and 'Hindutva'," Mishra added.

353.title: Help free Indian sailors held in Equatorial Guinea: Kerala CM to PM
353.article_body: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan on Tuesday sought PM Narendra Modi's intervention to facilitate the release of 16 Indian sailors, including three from Kerala, held hostage in Equatorial Guinea. Vijayan, in his letter, said that the crew of the ship did not engage in any unlawful activities and a further delay in bringing them back would make their lives unsafe.

354.title: 'RRR' beats '3 Idiots' to become 3rd highest-grossing Indian film in Japan
354.article_body: SS Rajamouli's 'RRR' has beaten Aamir Khan's '3 Idiots' to become the third highest-grossing Indian film in Japan. 'RRR' collected around ¥180 million (₹10 crore) in the country. The film is now behind Rajamouli's Baahubali 2: The Conclusion, which collected ¥300 million (₹16.75 crore), and Rajinikanth's 1995 film 'Muthu', which collected ¥400 million (₹22 crore).

355.title: Will do everything to ensure Chhawla rape victim gets justice: U'khand CM
355.article_body: After the SC acquitted the three accused in the 2012 Chhawla rape case, Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami assured that the 19-year-old victim, who was raped and killed, would get justice. "I have spoken to [the] advocate...and Union Law Minister Kiren Rijiju…The victim is the daughter of our country...we will do everything to ensure that she gets justice," said Dhami.

356.title: Territorial integrity a key condition to resume talks with Russia: Ukraine
356.article_body: Ukraine's National Security and Defence Council Secretary Oleksiy Danilov has said that the main condition for resumption of negotiations with Russia is restoration of Ukraine's territorial integrity. On Monday, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that he was open to only "genuine" negotiations that would restore Ukraine's borders.

357.title: Jubilant Foodworks Q2 net profit rises by 9.8% to ₹131.5 crore
357.article_body: Jubilant Foodworks, which operates Domino's Pizza and Dunkin' Donuts in India, posted a 9.8% rise in net profit at ₹131.5 crore for the September quarter as against ₹119.8 crore in the corresponding period last fiscal. The company's revenue from operations rose by 16.6% to ₹1,301.5 crore as compared to ₹1,116.2 crore in the year-ago period.

358.title: K'taka Cong to approach HC against order to block Twitter handles
358.article_body: Karnataka Congress will file a writ petition in the Karnataka High Court seeking to quash an order by a lower court directing Twitter to temporarily block the accounts of the Congress party and Bharat Jodo Yatra over alleged illegal use of sound records of 'KGF: Chapter 2' movie. Earlier, Congress said it hadn't received a copy of the order.

359.title: Sudha Murthy touches feet of Hindutva activist Sambhaji Bhide; video surfaces
359.article_body: Philanthropist Sudha Murthy, the wife of Infosys Co-founder Narayana Murthy, met Hindutva activist Sambhaji Bhide during an event in Maharashtra's Sangli and touched his feet to take his blessings. Bhide, a key accused in the Bhima Koregaon violence case, was dropped from the case after no evidence was found against him. A former RSS activist, Bhide founded Shiv Pratishthan Hindustan.

360.title: Drugs were f**king delicious, almost died in 2007 of overdose: Eminem
360.article_body: Talking about his struggles with addiction, rapper Eminem shared that he "almost died from an overdose in 2007". "Because drugs were f**king delicious...I had to go and f**k it all up and take too many," he said. Stating that music saved his life, Eminem remembered how he had to fight his way through to try and breakthrough in music.

361.title: This is anti-national: K'taka CM over Cong leader's 'Hindu' remark
361.article_body: Following Karnataka Congress leader Satish Jarkiholi's remark on the word 'Hindu', Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Tuesday said this is anti-national and everyone should condemn it. "Is Rahul Gandhi and Siddaramaiah's silence endorsing Satish's statements?" CM Bommai asked. "They make statements with half knowledge to appease voters of one community and dream to get minority votes," he stated.

362.title: Ukraine receives first delivery of NASAMS air defence systems
362.article_body: Ukrainian Defence Minister Oleksii Reznikov has said that Ukraine received its first NASAMS and Aspide air defence systems. Reznikov thanked US, Spain and Norway, saying that Ukraine will continue to shoot down enemy targets. Last week, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy urged G7 leaders to provide more help with air defence amid Russia's attacks on Ukraine's energy infrastructure.

363.title: Senior Congress leader KK Pandey dies during Rahul's Bharat Jodo Yatra
363.article_body: Senior Congress leader and general secretary of Congress Seva Dal, Krishna Kumar Pandey, died on Tuesday during Rahul Gandhi's Bharat Jodo Yatra in Maharashtra's Nanded. "He was walking along with me and Digvijaya Singh carrying the Tricolour. He handed over the flag to another person and about 15 minutes later he...suffered a heart attack," Congress' Jairam Ramesh said.

364.title: EAM Jaishankar meets Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov in Russia
364.article_body: External Affairs Minister Dr S Jaishankar and Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov held a meeting in Russia's Moscow today. "I believe this is the fifth time we're meeting this year and that speaks of long-term partnership and the importance we attach to each other. I'm really glad to be here...today to carry forward this dialogue," the EAM said in Moscow.

365.title: Chiratae Ventures raises $100 mn in 1st close of maiden growth fund
365.article_body: Chiratae Ventures, a venture capital firm that invests in early-stage startups, has secured $100 million in the first close of its maiden growth fund. It raised funds from investors including Kris Gopalakrishnan's family office, SBI and IIFL Wealth Management. Chiratae Ventures, founded in 2006, backed unicorns like Lenskart, cure.fit and Flipkart among others.

366.title: 73 infiltration bids reported in J&K in 2021, lowest in 5 yrs: Govt
366.article_body: The Ministry of Home Affairs has revealed that 73 infiltration attempts from Pakistan were reported in 2021, the lowest in five years. "In 2017, as many as 419 infiltration attempts were reported. The number stood at 328 in 2018, 216 in 2019 and 99 in 2020," MHA said. It also added that militancy in J&K is directly linked with infiltration.

367.title: Policybazaar to face ₹560 crore of ESOP expenses in FY23
367.article_body: Insurance aggregator platform Policybazaar will face ₹560 crore of employee stock option (ESOP) expenses in FY23, the company said during an earnings call. The company added that the cost of ESOPs granted in October last year will reduce gradually over the next few years. Policybazaar granted ESOPs worth ₹1,044 crore to three top executives in FY22.

368.title: England will beat India in T20 WC 2022 semi-final: Kevin Pietersen
368.article_body: Former England captain Kevin Pietersen said he "really" thinks that England will beat India in the upcoming T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final between the two sides on November 10 (Thursday). "There is a very good chance [that]...England [will take on] Pakistan [in the final]," added Pietersen. "I just need Virat Kohli to have a day off," he stated.

369.title: Renault, Google expand partnership to build 'software defined vehicle'
369.article_body: Renault and Google said on Tuesday that they are expanding their partnership in software services for future Renault vehicles. The "software-defined vehicle" will be built on Google's Android Automotive operating system and will send data to the company's cloud servers for processing. Google will become the preferred cloud supplier to the French automaker, the companies added.

370.title: Kerala Governor has lost his mental stability: CPI(M) state secretary
370.article_body: The CPI(M) on Tuesday distributed leaflets criticising Kerala Governor Arif Mohammed Khan and pointed fingers at his mental stability. CPI(M) state secretary MV Govindan said, "He (the Governor) has lost his mental stability. On November 15, we will stage a never seen before  [demonstration] when one lakh people will protest [outside] the official residence of the Governor."

371.title: UP man keeps stolen ₹18 lakh in drum at home, says got idea from Dhol movie
371.article_body: A man from Uttar Pradesh, who used to work as a driver in Delhi, returned home with ₹18 lakh, which he had stolen from his employer, reports said. He hid the money inside a drum. After the money was recovered, he told police that the idea of hiding the money in a drum came to him from the movie 'Dhol'.

372.title: It's become Cong leaders' habit to demean Hindus: Thakur on Jarkiholi's remark
372.article_body: Following Karnataka Congress leader Satish Jarkiholi's remark on the word 'Hindu', BJP leader Anurag Thakur said it has become a habit for Congress and AAP leaders to demean Hindus and insult Hindu Gods and Goddesses. "Only during elections do they remember Gods and Goddesses. Rest of the time, they keep abusing them," Thakur added.

373.title: Didn't plan to fall in love with man with whom I can't live: Neena on Richards
373.article_body: Talking about her relationship with ex-West Indies cricketer Vivian Richards, actress Neena Gupta said, "I didn't plan to fall in love with a person with whom I cannot live and have a child with him." "I never plan to do brave things in life...I never planned to show some act of bravery. I simply accepted...whatever God gave me," added Neena.

374.title: KKR to invest $400 mn in Vedanta's decarbonisation firm Serentica
374.article_body: Global investment firm KKR will invest $400 million in Serentica Renewables, a decarbonization platform that seeks to enable energy transition by providing clean energy solutions. Launched by Vedanta Group, Serentica plans to build 1,500 MW of solar and wind power projects in Karnataka, Maharashtra and Rajasthan. Serentica has entered into three long-term Power Purchase Agreements (PPAs).

375.title: Downturn in startup ecosystem to take 2-3 yrs to normalise: Zoho CEO
375.article_body: SaaS firm Zoho's Co-Founder and CEO Sridhar Vembu said the present economic downturn in the Indian tech and startup ecosystem could take two to three years to normalise. Vembu added, "At current pace, India could be our #2 market in four years and our top market in the next ten years." Chennai-based Zoho recently reported $1 billion in annual revenues.

376.title: Steel plant executive found dead at company's guest house in Odisha
376.article_body: A 59-year-old Jindal Steel and Power Limited plant executive was found dead in Odisha's Sundargarh, police said. The body of the deceased, who worked at a railway siding of the company's iron ore mines, was found by the caretaker of a guest house where he was staying. "It seemed someone hit his head with a blunt object," police added.

377.title: US man pleads guilty for obtaining $3.36 billion in crypto illegally
377.article_body: A US man pleaded guilty on November 4 to committing crypto fraud in September 2012 that amounted to $3.36 billion. The US Department of Justice seized $3.36 billion of bitcoin from James Zhong, who "unlawfully obtained" more than 50,000 bitcoin from dark web market Silk Road over 10 years ago. This was the second-largest financial seizure by the Justice Department.

378.title: Jarkiholi's remark on 'Hindu' his personal opinion, not party's: Shivakumar
378.article_body: Reacting to Karnataka Congress leader Satish Laxmanrao Jarkiholi's remark on the word 'Hindu', Karnataka Congress President DK Shivakumar said that his statement is his personal opinion and the party does not support it. "We will ask for his explanation on the same," he added. Jarkiholi on Sunday claimed that the word 'Hindu' hails from Persia and not India.

379.title: European Council Prez's speech for trade expo cancelled by China
379.article_body: The organisers of the 5th China International Import Expo held back a pre-recorded opening ceremony speech by the European Council president wherein he called for reduced EU trade dependency on China, European diplomats said. Charles Michel had also criticised Russia's "illegal war" in Ukraine in the pre-recorded message provided for the state-organised expo in Shanghai, the diplomats added.

380.title: BJP created illusion & smokescreen of growth in Gujarat: Congress
380.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram on Tuesday said that BJP has created an "illusion and smokescreen" of high growth in Gujarat and is being ruled as a "vassal state of Delhi". Chidambaram asserted that the promise of a "double engine" government by the BJP was an "empty boast", adding that people, including Scheduled Tribes and women, have been left out.

381.title: UBS to hire 3 Credit Suisse bankers to tap Indian diaspora: Report
381.article_body: UBS Group is hiring three private bankers from the Credit Suisse Group to tap the wealthy Indian diaspora, Bloomberg reported. Gautam Anand, Akshay Menon and Gautam Bhargava will reportedly join UBS in Singapore next year. Anand joined Credit Suisse in 2013, according to his LinkedIn profile. Menon and Bhargava joined Credit Suisse in 2013 and 2010, respectively.

382.title: Hyderabad Police warns against fraud electricity bill messages
382.article_body: Hyderabad Police has warned about fraud messages that threaten to disconnect people's electricity supply if they do not pay the bill immediately. Sub-inspector Gaddam Mahesh said such messages direct victims to a fraudster, who asks them to download screen sharing applications like AnyDesk. The fraudster then steals bank details of the victims and withdraws money from their accounts, Mahesh added.

383.title: I thought we were going to get married: Olivia Culpo on ex-boyfriend Nick
383.article_body: Nick Jonas' ex-girlfriend Olivia Culpo opened up about her past relationship with the singer-songwriter and said that she was under the impression that they would get married. "I moved to LA with him. I had no brand, no money and I was in love...but when he broke up...I was kind of left with no sense of identity," Olivia added.

384.title: Nothing wrong with what I said: Cong leader on his 'Hindu' remark
384.article_body: Responding to his controversial remark on the word 'Hindu', Karnataka Congress leader Satish Jarkiholi on Tuesday asserted that there was nothing wrong with what he said. Jarkiholi on Sunday said that the word 'Hindu' had Persian origins, adding that it has a "horrible and shameful" meaning. He further said that he'll resign as MLA if he's proven wrong.

385.title: 11 minors arrested in Hyderabad's hookah parlour raid
385.article_body: Hyderabad Detective Department's Special Crime Team raided a hookah parlour at Hyderabad's Himayatnagar and arrested 13 persons including 11 minors who were present there. The police also seized seven hookah pots, three hookah flavours, four alcohol bottles, 14 mobile phones and cash worth ₹2.03 lakh. The owner was running the hookah parlour in one converted portion of the house.

386.title: School van driver blackmails, rapes 14-year-old girl in Nagpur; arrested
386.article_body: Nagpur Police arrested a school van driver for allegedly raping a 14-year-old girl and blackmailing her by threatening to make her photographs viral. The accused allegedly raped her before dropping her off at school. According to the police, the accused kept on blackmailing the girl so that she would continue to be sexually exploited.

387.title: Why should I pay for blue tick now?: Woman who was among 1st Indians to join Twitter
387.article_body: Naina Redhu, who was among the first few Indians to join Twitter when it was launched in 2006, said Twitter's new monthly verification fee plan will not have much effect as it is 'not a necessity'. "If I haven't paid for this (blue tick) in the past 16 years then why should I (pay) now?" said Redhu.

388.title: Will resign if I'm wrong: K'taka Cong leader on his 'Hindu' remark
388.article_body: Karnataka Congress MLA and KPCC Working President Satish Jarkiholi, who sparked controversy after saying that the word Hindu has a dirty meaning, has said if he is proven wrong he will resign as MLA. "Let everyone prove I'm wrong. If I am wrong, I'll resign as MLA and not just apologise for my statement," Jarkiholi said on Tuesday.

389.title: Nearly 3 lakh posters, banners removed in 2 days ahead of Delhi MCD polls
389.article_body: Nearly three lakh posters and banners were removed in two days since the Model of Code of Conduct came into effect ahead of the Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) polls. A total of 1,20,515 posters and other materials were removed on November 6 and the number increased to 2,91,996 by November 7. MCD elections will be held on December 4.

390.title: Japan repatriates ex-US soldier, son who helped ex-Nissan chief flee
390.article_body: Two Americans who were convicted in Japan for helping former Nissan Chairman Carlos Ghosn escape to Lebanon have been repatriated to the US, their lawyer said on Tuesday. A court in July last year had awarded a prison sentence of two years to Michael Taylor, ex-US Special Forces member, and one year and eight months to his son, Peter Taylor.

391.title: PM Modi writes letter congratulating Palak Muchhal for her wedding, singer shares pic
391.article_body: Singer Palak Muchhal, who tied the knot with music composer Mithoon Sharma, shared a letter by PM Narendra Modi, who congratulated the couple on their wedding. "Dear Modi ji, your...letter has touched our hearts. We express our gratitude to you for this respect and love," tweeted Palak. "It's a matter of privilege for us to get your blessings," she added.

392.title: What is Mastodon, the social network users are leaving Twitter for?
392.article_body: Thousands of people who quit Twitter after Elon Musk's takeover have joined Mastodon, a free, open-source decentralised social media platform that allows users to share media and follow other accounts. Mastodon consists of independent, user-managed servers and users are based on one server but can interact freely with others. Unlike Twitter, Mastodon presents posts in chronological order.

393.title: Akshay to revive 'Hera Pheri', 'Awara...' & 'Welcome' franchises: Report
393.article_body: Akshay Kumar is in talks with producer Firoz Nadiadwala to revive 'Hera Pheri', 'Awara Paagal Deewana' and 'Welcome' franchises. "The talks are on with three top directors, and we expect an...announcement on one of the three projects in next few months," a source was quoted as saying. Akshay will next be seen in 'Bade Miyan Chote Miyan' and 'OMG 2'.

394.title: Mom gets emotional for stupid people, wishes she'd got offers earlier: Masaba
394.article_body: Actress Neena Gupta's daughter Masaba Gupta said that her mother gets emotional for stupid people. "So I tell her, treat people for what they are," she said, adding, "She often says that she wishes that she had received offers earlier in life, just like she's getting now. But, I just keep telling her to be grateful and...enjoy."

395.title: If Suryakumar fails, Team India will struggle to get 140: Gavaskar
395.article_body: Ahead of India's T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final against England, Sunil Gavaskar said India will "struggle" to score 140-150 if Suryakumar Yadav doesn't fire. "Suryakumar has got every shot in the book," added Gavaskar. Gavaskar further stated that India wouldn't have been able to score "even 150" in their T20 World Cup 2022 match against Zimbabwe without Suryakumar's unbeaten 61.

396.title: Pune Metro allows passengers to book tickets through WhatsApp
396.article_body: Passengers of Pune Metro can book their QR code-enabled tickets through WhatsApp by sending 'Hi' to the WhatsApp number 9420101990 or by scanning the QR code available at metro stations. They can pay for their tickets and recharge via an integrated payment partner after choosing their travel details on WhatsApp. This service will be available in Marathi, Hindi and English.

397.title: Woman ends life in B'luru as lover threatens to leak private videos
397.article_body: A 35-year-old therapist committed suicide in Bengaluru after her lover demanded ₹2 lakh from her by threatening to upload their private videos online, police said on Tuesday. In a video shot before her death, Chamundeshwari wished her lover, Mallikarjun, good luck in life and asked him not to trouble women in future. Chamundeshwari's husband has filed a complaint against Mallikarjun.

398.title: New monogram for King Charles' wife Camilla revealed
398.article_body: The new monogram for King Charles' wife, Queen Consort Camilla, has been unveiled by Buckingham Palace. Designed by Professor Ewan Clayton, the monogram combines Camilla's initial "C" and "R" for Regina - the Latin word for queen. It will be used by Camilla on personal letterheads, cards and gifts.

399.title: Karan shelved 'Screw Dheela' as Tiger Shroff demanded ₹30 cr: Report
399.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar reportedly shelved 'Screw Dheela' after Tiger Shroff demanded ₹30 crore to do the film. As per a source, Tiger was "very excited" about the project and refused to discuss his fee with Karan. However, his team informed Karan about Tiger's ₹30 crore fee. "Karan tried to explain to Tiger's team...But they wouldn't budge," the source added.

400.title: Don't know if I handled things with grace: Vijay on 'Liger' failure
400.article_body: Talking about how he dealt with Liger's failure, actor Vijay Deverakonda said, "I don't know if I've handled things with grace." He added that he's "very honest" about his emotions and expresses them as required. He said he will "always stand by" something that he "truly believes in" and will not be affected by how it is received.
